reasoning: Severe sepsis incidence ~75 per 100k from ICU and hospital surveillance data. Represents critical subset of sepsis cases with organ dysfunction. Significant mortality (30-40%), major public health burden.
source: Martin GS et al. (2003). The epidemiology of sepsis in the United States from 1979 through 2000. N Engl J Med. 348(16):1546-1554
